001package imagingbook.lib.tuples;
002
003/**
004 * A tuple with exactly 2 elements of arbitrary types.
005 *
006 * @param <T0> the type of element 0
007 * @param <T1> the type of element 1
008 */
009public final class Tuple2<T0, T1> implements Tuple {
010        
011        private final T0 item0;
012        private final T1 item1;
013        
014        public Tuple2(T0 item0, T1 item1) {
015                this.item0 = item0;
016                this.item1 = item1;
017        }
018        
019        public T0 get0() {
020                return item0;
021        }
022        
023        public T1 get1() {
024                return item1;
025        }
026        
027//      // needed??
028//      public Tuple2(Tuple2<? extends T0, ? extends T1> entry) {
029//        this(entry.item0, entry.item1);
030//    }
031        
032        @Override
033        public String toString() {
034                return String.format("<%s,%s>", item0.toString(), item1.toString());
035        }
036
037        public static <T0, T1> Tuple2<T0, T1> from(T0 val0, T1 val1) {
038                return new Tuple2<>(val0, val1);
039        }
040        
041}
042
043
